verse: Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God. (Matt 4:4)
Is not my word like fire, says the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces? (Jer 23:29)

The Word of God is living and effective: more piercing than any two-edged sword, reaching to the division even between the soul and the spirit, even between the joints and the marrow, and so it discerns the thoughts and intentions of the heart. (Heb 4:12)
Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my paths. (Ps 119:105)
Neither herb, nor poultice, healed them, but your word, O Lord, which heals all. (Wis 16:12)
I rejoice at your word like one who finds great treasure. I hate and detest falsehood, but I love your law. (Ps 119:162-163)

Blessed is the man who has not followed the counsel of the wicked, and has not remained in the way of sinners, and has not sat in the chair of scoffers. But his delight is with the law of the Lord, and he will meditate on his law, day and night. (Ps 1:1-2)
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. (Jn 1:1)
Blessed is he who reads or hears the words of this Prophecy, and who keeps the things that have been written in it. (Rev 1:3)

All Scripture, having been divinely inspired, is useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in justice, so that the man of God may be perfect, having been trained for every good work. (2 Tim 3:16-17)
Amen, amen, I say to you, that whoever hears my word, and believes in him who sent me, has eternal life, and he does not go into judgment, but instead he crosses from death into life. (Jn 5:24)
How can young people keep their way pure? By keeping to your words. (Ps 119:9)
I have hidden your word in my heart, so that I may not sin against you. (Ps 119:11)
Those who love your law have great peace, and nothing can make them stumble. (Ps 119:165)
Until I arrive, devote yourselves to public reading of scripture, to exhortation, and to teaching. (1 Tim 4:13)
Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will send a famine on the earth: not a famine of bread, nor of thirst for water, but for hearing the word of the Lord. (Amos 8:11)

As the rain comes down and the snow from heaven, and do not return there until watering the earth, making it bear and sprout, providing seed to the sower and food to eat, so shall my word be that goes forth out of my mouth; it shall not return to me empty, but it will accomplish that which I please, and cause it to succeed in what I sent it to do. (Is 55:10-11)

The law of the Lord is perfect; it refreshes the soul. The commands of the Lord are trustworthy, making wise the simple. The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart. The commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes. (Ps 19:7-8)

My child, attend to my words. Incline your ears to my sayings. Let them not depart from your eyes, keep them in the midst of your heart: For they are life to those that find them, and health to all flesh. (Pro 4:20-22)
Whatever was written, was written to teach us, so that, through patience and the consolation of the Scriptures, we might have hope. (Rom 15:4)
Faith comes by hearing, and what is heard comes through the word of Christ. (Rom 10:17)
Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away. (Matt 24:35)

The book of this law shall not depart from your mouth. Instead, you shall meditate upon it, day and night, so that you may observe and do all the things that are written in it. For then you shall make your way prosperous, and then you shall have good success. (Josh 1:8)
It is necessary for us to observe more thoroughly the things that we have heard, lest we let them slip away. (Heb 2:1)
Put away all filthiness and all wicked conduct. Accept with meekness the word that he plants in your hearts, which is able to save you. (Jas 1:21)
The mouths of the righteous speak wisdom, and their tongues speak what is just. The law of their God is in their hearts; their steps do not slip. (Ps 37:30-31)
I am not ashamed of the Gospel. For it is the power of God unto salvation for all believers, the Jew first, and also the Greek. (Rom 1:16)
He who gazes upon the perfect law of liberty, and who remains in it, is not a forgetful hearer, but instead a doer of the work. He shall be blessed in what he does. (Jas 1:25)
The grass has dried up, and the flower has fallen. But the Word of our Lord will stand forever. (Is 40:8)

Understand this first, that no prophecy of scripture is a matter of a personâ€™s own interpretation, because no prophecy ever came by will of humans, but people moved by the Holy Spirit spoke from God. (2 Pet 1:20-21)

Everyone who hears these words of mine and does them shall be compared to a wise man, who built his house upon the rock. And the rains descended, and the floods rose up, and the winds blew, and rushed upon that house, but it did not fall, for it was founded on the rock. (Matt 7:24-25)
By the word of the Lord were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth. (Ps 33:6)
I will never forget your precepts, for you have given me life through them. (Ps 119:93)
The promises of the Lord are pure; like silver refined in a furnace, purified seven times. (Ps 12:6)
Until heaven and earth pass away, not the smallest letter or one stroke of a letter, will pass from the law until all is fulfilled. (Matt 5:18)
The word of the Lord is right, and all his work is done in truth. (Ps 33:4)
Be doers of the Word, and not listeners only, deceiving yourselves. (Jas 1:22)
Give ear, O my people, to my law; incline your ears to the words of my mouth. (Ps 78:1)
Make my words your desire, and you will be well instructed. (Wis 6:11)

These words, which I command you this day, keep them in your heart; Teach them to your children. Talk of them when you are at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up. Bind them as a sign on your hand and let them be a symbol on your forehead. Write them on the doorposts of your houses and on your gates. (Deut 6:6-9)
If your law had not been my joy, then perhaps I would have perished in my misery. (Ps 119:92)
Set your thoughts on the precepts of God, and meditate at all times on his commandments. And he himself will give insight to your mind, and your desire for wisdom will be granted. (Sir 6:37)
You have been born again, not from corruptible seed, but from what is incorruptible, from the Word of God, living and remaining for all eternity. (1 Pet 1:23)
All flesh is like the grass and all its glory is like the flower of the grass. The grass withers and its flower falls away. But the Word of the Lord endures for eternity. (1 Pet 1:24)

Let the word of Christ dwell you in abundance, with all wisdom, teaching and correcting one another, with Psalms, hymns, and spiritual canticles, singing to God with gratitude in your hearts. (Col 3:16)
Everyone who does not remain in the teaching of Christ, but goes beyond it, does not have God. Whoever remains in the teaching, such a one has both the Father and the Son. (2 Jn 1:9)
The revealing of your words gives light; it gives understanding to the simple. (Ps 119:130)

I have rejoiced in the way of your commands, more than in all riches. I will meditate in your precepts, and fix my eyes on your ways. I will delight myself in your statutes: I will not forget your word. (Ps 119:14-16)
This is my comfort in my affliction: that your promises gives me life. (Ps 119:50)
As for my God, his way is perfect. The promise of the Lord proves true. He is the protector of all who hope in him. (Ps 18:30)
